content.raw: As a follow up, I should also mentioned that ignition was updated a few days ago. Is there any chance that this issue is related to this change? [#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/407/added-bridge-logger/diff](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/407/added-bridge-logger/diff)
content.html: As a follow up, I should also mentioned that ignition was updated a few days ago. Is there any chance that this issue is related to this change? #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/407/added-bridge-logger/diff

content.raw: It turns out that the issue has come from [PR 407](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/407/added-bridge-logger/diff). going back to commit [5dfeb39](#!/osrf/subt/commits/5dfeb39f94c35c04c5175689309a8bc19946d3bd) removes the error messages
content.html: It turns out that the issue has come from PR 407. going back to commit 5dfeb39 removes the error messages

content.raw: Actually I think this error message is related to the depth image compression.  I believe `cv_bridge` is attempting to compress the depth image but it is unable to do so because the depth image is in 32 bit floating point which is incompatible with JPEG compression.  This would explain why the `front/depth/compressed` is not populated while `front/depth` is populated with data.
content.html: Actually I think this error message is related to the depth image compression. I believe cv_bridge is attempting to compress the depth image but it is unable to do so because the depth image is in 32 bit floating point which is incompatible with JPEG compression. This would explain why the front/depth/compressed is not populated while front/depth is populated with data.

content.raw: Issue #363 was marked as a duplicate of this issue.
content.html: Issue #363 was marked as a duplicate of this issue.

content.raw: Under Issue 363 I mentioned that this started happening when bridge\_logger was added.  The real solution is probably to add a float->8bit conversion step before giving the image data to the compression engine.  I have found it helpful to comment out the bridge\_logger node in competition\_init.launch in order to suppress the verbose printing until the root of the problem gets solved.
content.html: Under Issue 363 I mentioned that this started happening when bridge_logger was added. The real solution is probably to add a float->8bit conversion step before giving the image data to the compression engine. I have found it helpful to comment out the bridge_logger node in competition_init.launch in order to suppress the verbose printing until the root of the problem gets solved.

content.raw:

```

77.720000000 ERROR /A60F300L/ros_ign_image_depth [/tmp/binarydeb/ros-melodic-theora-image-transport-1.9.5/src/theora_publisher.cpp:173(TheoraPublisher::publish)] [topics: /rosout, /A60F300L/front/depth/compressedDepth, /A60F300L/front/depth/compressedDepth/parameter_descriptions, /A60F300L/front/depth/compressedDepth/parameter_updates, /A60F300L/front/depth/compressed, /A60F300L/front/depth/compressed/parameter_descriptions, /A60F300L/front/depth/compressed/parameter_updates, /A60F300L/front/depth, /A60F300L/front/depth/theora, /A60F300L/front/depth/theora/parameter_descriptions, /A60F300L/front/depth/theora/parameter_updates] cv_bridge exception: '[32FC1] is not a color format. but [bgr8] is. ...
```

content.raw: pull request #429 stops the warnings from printed but does not solve the underlying issue. Need to disable compression on depth topics
content.html: pull request #429 stops the warnings from printed but does not solve the underlying issue. Need to disable compression on depth topics

content.raw:
Arthur: “I believe `cv_bridge` is attempting to compress the depth image”.

Would it do so even, if there are no subscribers of `front/depth/compressed` ?
content.html:
Arthur: “I believe cv_bridge is attempting to compress the depth image”.

Would it do so even, if there are no subscribers of front/depth/compressed ?

content.raw: The new bridge logger adds a subscriber. The [#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/429/disable-loggin-of-compressed-and-theora](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/429/disable-loggin-of-compressed-and-theora) removes that subscriber. Unfortunately it disables logging of all compressed topics - not only depth - even jpegs, that work just fine and it is the interface we use.
content.html: The new bridge logger adds a subscriber. The #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/429/disable-loggin-of-compressed-and-theora removes that subscriber. Unfortunately it disables logging of all compressed topics - not only depth - even jpegs, that work just fine and it is the interface we use.
